name: BedType
title: Saner Bed Type Coding System
description: This Coding System fills gaps describing types of care services that a bed can support.

concept.definition: Rooms used for treatment of inpatient or ambulatory patients
Operating Rooms used for surgical procedures. When a room is used for both surgical andnon-surgical procedures, it should be classified as an operating room.
Procedure Rooms are those rooms used for non-surgical procedures
Recovery Rooms
Rooms used for principally for patient examination and minor procedures
Room used for dialysis treatment
Beds in a Burn Unit
Beds in a negative pressure isolation environment
Beds in an other (non-negative pressure) isolation environment
Bed in a unit that does not support isolation
Resources designated for neonatal use
Resources designated for adult patient use
Resources designated for pediatric patient use
Total physical resources, whether licensed, staffed, or otherwise
Maximum licensed resources
Overflow / Surge resources that can be or have been added to add capacity
Resources for which staff is available to provide support
Resources that can be used but which are not staffed
Resources that are currently in use

concept.display: This resource is available for use
concept.definition: Resources that are available for use

concept.display: This resource is not available for use
concept.definition: Resources that are not available and are not in use
